property.name: Survey Unit ID
property.description: The current autonumbering assumes single device in field. If multiple devices are in use, uniqueness rules must be defined.

lookup.term: {A} Description TBD
{B} Description TBD
{C} Description TBD
{D} Description TBD

property.name: Landform pattern
property.description: A combination of relief, slope, stream channel occurance and mode of geomorphological activity within the of the survey unit. What landform pattern comprises the majority (>50%) of the survey unit? Minimum size of a landform pattern is circle 300 m in diameter circle with you at the centre. If a landform pattern that is greater in size is encountered, create a new survey unit.

lookup.term: {0No_Observation}
{0No_Observation}

property.name: Landform notes
property.description: Optional. Provide any additional descriptive notes if required.

property.name: Vegetation Structure–Upper
property.description: Categories based on the growth form, height and cover within the survey unit. Describe the vegetation structure for the dominant or tallest stratum, if present. What is the vegetation structure that comprises the majority (>50%) of the survey unit?

lookup.term: {0No_Observation}
{b1.0} Soil, rock or water surfaces with less than 0.5% plant cover.

{c1.0} Assemblages of one or more species of minute plants at or within the surface of soil or rock. May consist of bryophytes, lichens, cyanobacteria, green algae and fungi; may in some cases include very small vascular plants.

{f1.0} A member of the Division Pterophyta (i.e.ferns and fern allies). Characterised by large and usually branched leaves (fronds); herbaceous and terrestrial to aquatic; spores in sporangia on the undersides of leaves. Tree ferns are classified with woody plants as they have the same vegetation structure.

property.name: Vegetation Structure–Mid-stratum
property.description: Describe the vegetation structure for the mid-stratum, if present. What is the vegetation structure that comprises the majority (>50%) of the survey unit?

lookup.term: {0No_Observation}
{b1.0} Soil, rock or water surfaces with less than 0.5% plant cover.

{c1.0} Assemblages of one or more species of minute plants at or within the surface of soil or rock. May consist of bryophytes, lichens, cyanobacteria, green algae and fungi; may in some cases include very small vascular plants.

{f1.0} A member of the Division Pterophyta (i.e.ferns and fern allies). Characterised by large and usually branched leaves (fronds); herbaceous and terrestrial to aquatic; spores in sporangia on the undersides of leaves. Tree ferns are classified with woody plants as they have the same vegetation structure.

property.name: Vegetation Structure–Ground stratum
property.description: Describe the vegetation structure for the ground-stratum, if present. What is the vegetation structure that comprises the majority (greater than 50%) of the survey unit? Usually less than 2.0 m in height.

lookup.term: {0No_Observation}
{b1.0} Soil, rock or water surfaces with less than 0.5% plant cover.

{c1.0} Assemblages of one or more species of minute plants at or within the surface of soil or rock. May consist of bryophytes, lichens, cyanobacteria, green algae and fungi; may in some cases include very small vascular plants.

{f1.0} A member of the Division Pterophyta (i.e.ferns and fern allies). Characterised by large and usually branched leaves (fronds); herbaceous and terrestrial to aquatic; spores in sporangia on the undersides of leaves. Tree ferns are classified with woody plants as they have the same vegetation structure.

property.name: Vegetation notes
property.description: Note any recognisable species that are particularly dominant, known classifications for the ecosystem or other pertinent information

lookup.term: {0No_Observation}
{Heavy} Greater than 70%
{Mid_dense} 30–70% cover
{Sparse} 10–30% cover
{Very_sparse} Less than 10%

property.name: Ground surface notes
property.description: Describe any factors or issues affecting ground cover

property.name: Photo
property.description: Take a photo that best represents the survey unit.
